item.title: Lethal Company Teases New Creature for Next Update
item.description:
Summary

  • Zeekerss is teasing a powerful new creature for Lethal Company, hinting at more upcoming monsters in the game.
  • Prior statements suggest the possibility of multiple new creatures being added, with potential surprises for players and their co-op partners.
  • Competition from games like REPO has spurred Zeekerss to consider further updates, indicating dangerous new content on the horizon for Lethal Company.

Lethal Company 's sole developer, Zeekerss, is teasing a new monster coming to the game. The developer has been hinting at some additions to Lethal Company recently, and fans are eager for some updates to the game.

Though still in Early Access, Lethal Company took the gaming world by storm when it launched back in late 2023. The title gained popularity not only for its horrifying creatures and increasingly difficult gameplay, but due to the hilarity and hijinks that can occur when playing the game with friends. Zeekerss at one point professed feeling burned out on updating the game, moving much of his focus to upcoming work. However, that seems to have changed as of late.

On Twitter, Zeekerss revealed that a new creature is being added to the game, and it sounds as though it may be one of players' biggest threats yet. Not much has been said about it outside of a cryptic tweet, where Zeekerss stated that it might be the most powerful creature yet, and that its power "goes to its head." They also noted that the Lethal Company creature sometimes acts in ways that "make absolutely no sense, just because it can." However, the developer has had nothing further to say about the particular creature, leaving his audience to conjure up ideas of what it might be like.

Lethal Company May Get More Monsters

While this particular creature being teased doesn't have a release date, prior statements by Zeekerss may indicate that the game could be getting more than one new creature in the future. Back in April, Zeekerss teased that he was considering adding a "creature or two." It's not clear at this time whether the second creature has been scrapped, delayed, or if there will be a surprise waiting for players and their co-op partners with the update.

While Zeekerss has added new content to the game previously, it seems that in this case, competition did the developer a little good. Zeekerss mentioned that he had recently been playing REPO , which has been regularly compared to Lethal Company since its launch. REPO bears strong similarities to Lethal Company , with both titles essentially being co-op survival horror games that task players with bringing back a set amount of loot from each location they visit. However, there's also a considerable number of differences between the two, and it seems that time playing REPO got the developer thinking about further updates to Lethal Company , which he suggested would "be a little while" back in April. It's not clear how much longer players will have to wait for an update, but something new - and dangerous - is on the horizon for Lethal Company .

item.title: Persona 5: The Phantom X Could Be a Trailblazer for the Series
item.description:
Atlus is preparing for another major milestone in the Persona franchise with the global release of Persona 5: The Phantom X on June 26, 2025. Launching on mobile and PC platforms, the free-to-play game represents a bold shift for the studio, one that could reshape its approach to future projects. While Persona has had mobile tie-ins in the past, Phantom X is its most expansive and ambitious mobile effort to date.

That scale is already paying off. With over one million pre-registrations in the West as of May 23, 2025, Persona 5: The Phantom X is on track to be one of Atlus’ most visible global launches. If it succeeds, it may signal that the Persona series can thrive on mobile in the same way other Japanese RPG franchises have, without needing to compromise its identity.

Persona 5: The Phantom X Expands Franchise Reach

Unlike previous mobile-adjacent releases, Persona 5: The Phantom X is designed from the ground up as a full-fledged experience for mobile and PC players. While Persona Q2 explored handheld systems and titles like Persona O.A. offered companion functionality, Phantom X is a substantial standalone game. It introduces a new cast, setting, and story arc that echo the themes of Persona 5 while offering enough distinction to stand on its own.

It’s a strategy similar to Square Enix’s mobile adaptations like Final Fantasy Brave Exvius or Kingdom Hearts Union X Dark Road . Both titles extended their franchises beyond consoles while preserving core lore and aesthetics. Phantom X seems poised to do the same, acting as a bridge between existing fans and new players who may discover Persona for the first time through their phones.

The game’s protagonist, Wonder, sports a Robin Hood-themed Persona named Jánošík, symbolizing heroic outlaw and justice, traits that potentially reflect his strategic leadership in combat.

The opportunity for expansion doesn’t end with mobile. Should the game maintain strong engagement post-launch, a console version could be feasible. Games like Genshin Impact proved that free-to-play titles can thrive across multiple platforms, especially when they deliver a consistent gameplay loop that appeals to both casual and dedicated users.

Monetization Could Make or Break Persona 5: The Phantom X

Despite the excitement, Phantom X must avoid the pitfalls that have plagued other mobile RPGs. Free-to-play games often walk a fine line between offering enticing content and locking progression behind aggressive monetization. If Atlus leans too heavily on paywalls, it could face the kind of backlash seen with Persona 3 Reload’s controversial DLC strategy.

The expansion Episode Aigis -The Answer , which was originally part of Persona 3 FES , was sold separately as premium content in Reload . SEGA later confirmed (as reported by Noisy Pixel) that DLC sales were “substantial,” but the community response was mixed at best. Many players criticized the decision to charge for content that was once included in the base game, raising concerns about how future entries or remakes might be handled.

Atlus has not yet detailed the monetization model for the global version of Phantom X , but the success of the game will likely hinge on maintaining a fair balance between free content and optional purchases.

Cosmetic upgrades, event-based characters, and extra dungeons in Phantom X could serve as acceptable monetization routes. But key story content and core mechanics should remain accessible to all players. This is especially important if Atlus plans to turn Phantom X into a live-service title with ongoing updates and seasonal content. Trust is currency in the mobile space, and fans are quick to spot manipulation.

Persona 5: The Phantom X Deepens Series Lore

One of the most intriguing aspects of Phantom X is how it further expands the Persona 5 universe. While previous games like Persona 5 Royal , Dancing in Starlight , and Persona 5 Strikers already extended the world of the Phantom Thieves, Phantom X offers new territory to explore, both narratively and thematically. It proves that Atlus still sees Persona 5 as fertile ground for storytelling, even years after its original release.

The addition of fresh characters and a new Metaverse framework suggests that Phantom X is more than just fan service. It could introduce lore that impacts future spin-offs or even mainline entries. That alone makes it worth watching, especially as Atlus continues to build momentum with projects like The Raidou Remastered: The Mystery of the Soulless Army , launching just one week before Phantom X on June 19, 2025.

Atlus is tapping into both nostalgia and innovation, offering something familiar yet forward-facing. If this dual strategy works, Phantom X may become a model for how the studio treats its other properties, from a possible Persona 4 remake to entirely new mobile narratives.

item.title: Deliver At All Costs: How To Fast Travel
item.description:
The world featured in Deliver At All Costs spans across three major bustling cities, each offering unique side missions to complete and collectibles to acquire. While players can drive around town, causing mayhem and destruction in their wake, it can be a little time-consuming. If you need to travel to another city or a far-off area on the map, trains and boats can come in handy to act as fast travel points between the locations. Here's how to use them and make traveling easier.

The second section of this guide may contain mild spoilers for the end of Act 1 of Deliver At All Costs .

How to Fast Travel in Deliver At All Costs

Whether you choose to fast travel by boat or by train in Deliver At All Costs , it's totally free and does not require money.

As there are three large-scale maps in Deliver At All Costs , players have an option to use fast-travel to cover long stretches of distance quickly. There are two main ways to fast travel in the game, by boat or by train. However, it isn't like traditional fast travel akin to other games, as players can only travel between a charted course represented by dotted lines (especially when it comes to boats).

Fast traveling by boat is the first option that players will spot when they start the game and get introduced to the city of St. Monique. After opening the map, you'll spot the little boat icons/stickers, which will indicate where you need to go in order to hitch a ride. Once you arrive at the pier, simply talk to the captain, and they'll help you get to the destination quickly.

How to Unlock Fast Travel Through Trains

Players will unlock fast travel by train after reaching the second act/city, Shellington, in Deliver At All Costs . You'll arrive at Shellington after completing Chapter 5: Critical Mass and surviving a rather disastrous event in St. Monique. Here, you'll be able to travel between cities quickly using the train stations marked on your map.

So, if boats allow players to reach far-off points within a city, trains allow inter-city travel , so they won't have to worry about traffic on the highway anymore. Simply arrive at one of the stations and choose which unlocked city to travel to (on the platform) in Deliver At All Costs .

item.title: World of Warcraft Classic Brings Back Huge Experience Buff Ahead of Mists of Pandaria Launch
item.description:
Summary

  • The Joyous Journeys 50% XP boost in WoW Classic runs until July 1.
  • The boost applies from level 1 to 85 immediately upon spawn.
  • The upcoming Mists of Pandaria Pre-Patch adds the Pandaren race, Monk class, AoE looting, and more.

World of Warcraft Classic is bringing back the Joyous Journeys 50% experience buff from now until the Mists of Pandaria Pre-Patch on July 1. Players can benefit from this huge boost to experience gains in World of Warcraft Classic for over a month as they prepare for the new expansion’s release.

Joyous Journeys is a 50% experience boost that World of Warcraft periodically brings back to the game ahead of major releases. It first appeared in 2022 in the months leading up to Wrath of the Lich King Classic , but it has been re-enabled multiple times during the expansion and in Cataclysm Classic after.

Now, this experience buff is returning to Cataclysm Classic one last time. From now until the Mists of Pandaria Pre-Patch on July 1, fans can benefit from this 50% increase to all experience gains in World of Warcraft Classic ’s progression servers. This boost kicks in immediately at level 1 upon spawning into one's World of Warcraft starting zone and lasts all the way to the current level cap of 85, making it a great way to prepare a new character for the next expansion. This experience buff is only available in World of Warcraft: Cataclysm Classic , and is not present in Classic Era, Classic Fresh, Season of Discovery, or modern WoW .

50% Experience Boost in Classic WoW Until Mists of Pandaria Pre-Patch

  • Mists of Pandaria Pre-Patch begins July 1

The Joyous Journeys buff is enabled automatically, meaning players don’t need to do anything special to benefit from it. Fans who don’t want to use this buff can disable it at any innkeeper located in capital cities, after which they can turn it back on from the same NPCs at any time.

The Pre-Patch for World of Warcraft: Mists of Pandaria Classic may spell the end of Joyous Journeys for now, but it will add tons of other content instead. The Pandaren race, Monk class, and revamped talent trees are joined by new game features like Pet Battles, AoE looting, and more. Additionally, fans can enjoy the limited-time Attack on Theramore Isle world event, and take part in the Theramore’s Fall scenario. What’s more, players who complete the Pandaren starting experience in Mists of Pandaria Classic before the end of July can earn the Shaohao’s Sage Serpent mount for modern WoW .

Fans who would prefer to skip the leveling process can alternatively earn a free Level 85 Character Boost through Season of Discovery. By defeating Balnazzar, the first boss of WoW Classic Season of Discovery’s Scarlet Enclave raid, at least once before June 30, players can score this $60 game service at no cost.

item.title: Oblivion Remastered Player Shares Easy Way to Level Up Combat Skills
item.description:
Summary

  • Gain free skill points in Blade and Block by watching Blades members spar at Cloud Ruler Temple.
  • Obtain extra skill points in hand-to-hand combat by watching NPCs spar at The Arena.
  • Players are sharing helpful tips on how to maximize skill points in Oblivion Remastered.

A fan of The Elder Scrolls 4: Oblivion Remastered has shared an easy way to gain skill in Blade and Block, and another way has been shared by the community to raise Hand to Hand skill. The simple method merely requires Oblivion Remastered players to wait in a specific location, and they'll be granted free skill points.

Oblivion Remastered fans are still having a ton of fun exploring the game, as the open world of Oblivion has always been full of surprises. While leveling skills in Oblivion Remastered isn't a hugely difficult thing, getting extra for doing next to nothing is something most fans won't want to overlook.

On Reddit, user Psycho-FangSenpai shared their discovery that there's a simple way to get some extra points in Blade and Block skill in Oblivion Remastered . In a brief video, their character stands stock-still as two Blades have a practice fight. After watching them spar for a while, a message pops up informing the player that due to watching the Blades battle, they've gained two points in both Blade and Block skill. These two Blades members, Fortis and Pelagius, can be found at the Cloud Ruler Temple, for those who want to get some extra skill points.

Players who like to play Oblivion Remastered with hand-to-hand combat, or just want a well-rounded skill set, can also gain some skill points of their own. Players will need to visit The Arena in Oblivion Remastered . Once there, one simply needs to locate a pair of sparring NPCs named Branwen and Saliith. By watching them for a while, players will gain five points in Hand to Hand combat.

Oblivion Remastered Players Share Additional Tips

Numerous fans seem to have overlooked this particular detail, and are happy to discover that they can earn a couple of extra points. Players have recommended that fans watch the sparring once they reach expert level, as skill points become more difficult to gain the higher a player's skill is. However, fans should be aware that there's a limit for gaining skill from watching a fight, with 90 being the skill cap for both the Arena fighters and the Blades.

While there's no wrong way to play Oblivion Remastered , players are actively sharing advice with one another with some helpful tips. For example, one player recently showed a great place to stash items in Oblivion Remastered , while others have highlighted changes made to the way Sneaking works over the original game, or an odd horse that can be found in the remaster that doesn't exist in the first version. Though a lot of Oblivion Remastered 's secrets are already known courtesy of fans having fully explored the original version from top to bottom, there are still some details that can get overlooked.
